item.title: Help with custom command
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:3, topic:22913”]The public void is actually called “ScanItems”[br][size=1]Posted at: November 07, 2006, 12:47:19 PM[/size][hr]I get an error:

client.java:10435: illegal start of expression
public void ScanItems();
^
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]
Then take out the public void and just have ScanItems();

Read full topic

item.title: Help with custom command
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:1, topic:22913”]Ok, in my server I have a public void called “scanitems” I’ve been trying to script up a command that will run scanitems. Here is what I have so far.


if (command.startsWith("checkitems"))
                     {
			public void ScanItems();
                      }

Im not very advanced with Java so I was hoping someone could help me.[/quote]
This is not spelt the same as your void… (no caps)

public void ScanItems();

Make look like this

public void scanitems();

Read full topic

item.title: Help with custom command
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Ok, in my server I have a public void called “scanitems” I’ve been trying to script up a command that will run scanitems. Here is what I have so far.


if (command.startsWith("checkitems"))
                     {
			public void ScanItems();
                      }

Im not very advanced with Java so I was hoping someone could help me.

Read full topic
